entry.title: Combined summary - Bug in genbuild.sh ?
entry.summary: The email conversation between Francis GASCHET and Wladimir is about a problem encountered by Francis while executing genuid.sh after compiling Bitcoin core on Debian 7. The error message "too many arguments" was displayed, which prompted Francis to share a solution of modifying the genbuild.sh file using a diff command. The changes made were in the if condition where git rev-parse --is-inside-work-tree was executed. The modification included adding double quotes to "$(git rev-parse --is-inside-work-tree 2>/dev/null)" = "true". This modification helped to resolve the issue and the execution of genuid.sh worked fine.Wladimir acknowledged Francis' solution and informed him that there is already an existing issue for this problem on Github. However, he mentioned that Rebroad's solution contains a new error and will merge Francis' patch instead. Overall, the email conversation highlights the importance of sharing solutions and collaborating to address issues encountered while working with Bitcoin core on Debian 7.
